title: Bane

Level 1 Enchantment Spell

Up to 3 creatures receive a -1d4 penalty to Attack Rolls and Saving Throws.

9m CHA Save Concentration

Bane is a Level is a Spell in Baldur's Gate 3. Bane is a Lvl 1 Spell from the Enchantment school, and it inflicts a penalty to Attack Rolls and saving throws. Spells can be used for dealing damage to Enemies, inflict Status Ailments, buff Characters or interact with the environment.

Bane Information

Description: Up to 3 creatures receive a -1d4 penalty to Attack Rolls and Saving Throws. Level: 1 Spell School: Enchantment Casting Time: Action Duration: 10 turns Range: 9m Requires Concentration: Yes Saving Throw: Charisma

How to Acquire Bane

Bane can be acquired by the following classes: Bard, Cleric, Warlock: Thief of Five Fates, Oath of Vengeance Bane can be cast by using the following items: Gloves of Power will give you bane if you don't have Absolute's mark. Blurg sells The Baneful, a shortsword that gives a chance to Bane the target when a Warlock uses it as their pact weapon or an Eldritch Knight uses it with Weapon Bond.

Bard, Cleric, Warlock: Thief of Five Fates, Oath of Vengeance

Gloves of Power will give you bane if you don't have Absolute's mark. Blurg sells The Baneful, a shortsword that gives a chance to Bane the target when a Warlock uses it as their pact weapon or an Eldritch Knight uses it with Weapon Bond.

Bane Tips & Notes

Upcasting: Affects an extra target for each Spell Slot Level above 1st. Despite a range of 30ft/9m, due to how bane's targeting works it can affect creatures up to 60ft/18m away. Usually the player will not be able to specifically choose which three creatures are affected. The penalty from bane is easy to miss, as it is applied silently. Hovering the cursor over the die roll will show an an unnamed penalty being applied. Differences from D&D 5th Edition: In 5E, the caster may specifically choose the targets, but they must all be within 30ft.
